translation.en: Are you filming?
Yes.
I see.
What are you filming?
They're filming you having a haircut?
He didn't tell you in advance.
You could have dressed nicer today.
Stop joking.
Auntie, don't be nervous.
I'm not, this is normal.
-Chef. -Hey.
Wine for tonight. We still have some Acacias, Hervé Villemade,
translation.ko: 와인은 에르베 빌메이드 아카시아가 아직 남았고

translation.en: followed by Chardonnay, Michel Gahier from Jura.
translation.ko: 그 뒤에는 쥐라산 미셸 가이에 샤르도네

translation.en: After, L'escarpolette Le Blanc from the South of France.
translation.ko: 프랑스 남부산 르에스카르폴레트 르 블랑이 있죠

translation.en: First floor, it will be Constellations, Domaine Mamaruta.
-Bon service. -Bon service!
-Hello, how are you? -Hey, how are you?
-You're the chef of this restaurant? -Yes, André.
You're quite young.
Thank you.
How are you? Hello!
-Good evening. -Good evening.
I told Laurent Pourcel
that we had dined at André's in Singapore and he said, "Chef André!"
translation.ko: 싱가포르 안드레에 갔다니까 바로 '셰프 안드레'라고 하더군요

translation.en: -Monsieur André! -Monsieur André!
He said, "Monsieur André."
I thought I have to tell you that.
-Monsieur André. -Monsieur André.
I thought that was great.
-Thank you. -Thank you.
-I want seafood noodles -Okay.
and seafood porridge
without the porridge.
No rice for you?
-No rice. -Okay.
So whatever you're doing is fine,
just be very natural, soak in the atmosphere.
You can look around, change your body posture.
Just be your normal self.
That's for me?
Bonjour, Chef!
-How are you? -I'm good. A bit tired.
Is that so? Emotionally?
I'm a bit sad.
-You've been here for eight years, right? -I…
Yes, but I've been in Singapore for ten years.
Ten years?
-Right, because there was Jaan. -Yes.
Yes. Very good.
Yes, it's good.
-And your career took off here as well. -Yes.
After Restaurant André, I want to do more.
translation.ko: 레스토랑 안드레 이후에 더 도전하고 싶어요

translation.en: Here, we're open 5 days a week, 15 hours a day.
Yes, of course.
I can't do anything else. Time is very limited.
translation.ko: 다른 일을 못 해요 시간이 없어서요

translation.en: And you're going to do more in Taiwan?
People have been talking about Asian cuisines for a while,
translation.ko: 아시아 요리에 대한 관심이 한동안 계속됐지만

translation.en: but they never mentioned Taiwan, so in the future, I think it will…
-Be more popular. -Yes, it will.
RAW has been open for three and a half years.
translation.ko: 타이완에 있는 로는 3년 반 동안 영업했어요

translation.en: Yes, it can really become a culinary destination.
translation.ko: 그래, 누구나 찾는 레스토랑이 될 수 있어

translation.en: Next month, Michelin is coming to Taipei.
Oh, right.
Yes, next month.
You won't participate in Michelin anymore, right?
Yes, I won't join anymore.
It doesn't matter to you now.
Well, in the future… You know how it is.
Yes.
Does your team rarely change?
Yes, our turnover rate is very low.
But that's good, I like this kind of kitchen.
It's like…
It's very straight forward. Yes, and that way, I am involved in everything.
translation.ko: 아주 솔직해요 그렇게 모든 일에 관여하죠

translation.en: Then it won't…
You can see it all. Yes.
The sous-chef has been here for ten years. Yes.
-And you're close when you're not working? -Yes.
translation.ko: - 근무 시간 아닐 때도 친해요? - 네

translation.en: But they all work very hard.
That's why sometimes, it's good to take a rest.
But after working at Restaurant André,
their path would be a little smoother in the future.
The most important thing is to make sure that they have opportunities.
translation.ko: 가장 중요한 건 기회를 주는 거야

translation.en: Then the ones who want to continue on this path can do it.
translation.ko: 요리를 계속하고 싶은 사람이 할 수 있게 해야지

translation.en: It's becoming harder to work with the new generation.
They want to be the boss.
-Right away. -Yes.
They work here for a year and they want to be the boss.
translation.ko: 여기서 1년 일하고 나면 사장이 되고 싶어 하죠

translation.en: They don't want to work at a top restaurant.
translation.ko: 최고의 레스토랑에서 일하고 싶어 하지 않아요

translation.en: And it's the same everywhere now.
Yes.
They'd rather make stupid muffins
with marmalade and bagels.
Then they're happy.
Young people these days
are the Internet generation where everything moves so fast.
translation.ko: 모든 게 급속도로 변하는 인터넷 세대야

translation.en: -Yes, really fast. -Like this.
It's the same in Europe.
It's hard to find good staff in France now.
translation.ko: 요즘엔 프랑스에서 좋은 직원을 찾기 힘들어

translation.en: They come and work for a week or maybe 15 days.
And when they don't like it, they leave without even taking their salary at times.
translation.ko: 가끔은 돈도 안 받고 그냥 떠나 버려

translation.en: One morning, they're just gone.
Yes.
-How is Chef Laurent doing? -Chef Laurent? He's good.
translation.ko: - 로랑 셰프는 어떻게 지내요? - 잘 지내

translation.en: Chef Laurent…
I always tell him that he's working too much.
He's under too much pressure.
It's not good for his health.
I think so too.
Even I can feel it working here for 15 hours a day.
You need to listen to your body.
Your body will tell you when to slow down.
translation.ko: 무리해선 안 된다고 몸이 알려 주거든

translation.en: -We never have the opportunity -No.
to talk about this.
That's true.
But we never lost touch
over the past 20 years.
Even if sometimes we don't see each other
or don't even talk for several months, the friendship is still strong.
translation.ko: 몇 달간 얘기를 안 해도 우정은 한결같지

translation.en: The food was amazing, but that was no surprise of course.
That was no surprise.
Yes.
When I have more time,
I really want to go back
to France or go to Saigon with Pam.
-All right. -We can come visit.
-Let's set a date. -Yes.
Tell me in advance, I'll come over.
Maybe Laurent can come too. And we can spend time together.
translation.ko: 로랑도 올 수 있어 같이 시간을 보내는 거야

translation.en: Yes.
The olive tree is staying.
-Where did you get it from? Europe or… -Yes.
Okay. It's great, really beautiful.
Almost like a bonsai, it grows like this.
And with the lights as well.
All right.
translation.ko: 그래 - 이만 가지, 고마워 - 안전히 돌아가세요

translation.en: -Ciao, thank you. -Have a nice trip back. Thank you, Chef.
Let's see about Saigon or somewhere else.
-See you soon. -Good night.
-Thank you, Chef. -See you.
This is unacceptable.
-Tony… -We'll change that.
-Control the fire. -Yes.
Turn it once in a while, if you…
The dishes here have just been served.
Why do these things keep getting smaller?
-This fish is small. -Yes.
They're becoming smaller. There are only five pieces here.
This has only four… five pieces.
Five pieces in total.
Should we spread them apart?
Because if they're too big, they'd stick together.
Some pieces of fish are…
-Don't arrange them too closely. -We must…
Spread them wider to make them look nicer.
-Oui. -Oui.
Isn't it?
Yes, of course. You can't succeed if you're not tough.
translation.ko: 네, 물론이죠 안 그럼 성공 못 해요

translation.en: Yes, we believe that.
He's not easy on everything.
It must be hard.
We cannot relax, we cannot sit down, we cannot take it lightly.
translation.ko: 쉬거나 앉지 못하고 마음 편히 있을 수도 없죠

translation.en: It's good for us, I believe.
Yes. Actually, that was my plan.
I was well-dressed, I had makeup on,
I dined here, and then looked for Chef.
"Chef, I want to work here." He said that there weren't any vacancies.
Okay, I will start by cleaning the toilet first. I'll start with that.
-Oh my God. -Where's the…
Can you hear me?
There are changes to the seating arrangements tomorrow.
Can my friends and I join tables with Grace?
translation.ko: 저랑 제 친구들이 그레이스와 앉아도 될까요?

translation.en: -We can? Okay, bye. -Yes? Okay, cool.
Seven, eight, nine, ten, eleven, twelve, thirteen, fourteen.
Go this way.
-I'm so happy. Yes. -Very happy to see you again.
"YOU'RE MY CHEF."
When I heard that the restaurant was closing,
I felt very angry at first
because it was my dream to be here.
I want to commit my life here,
every off-day,
every moment we're working together like a family.
So at first, I was very angry with him.
Why did you give up? Why do you want to close?
translation.ko: 왜 포기하는 거죠? 왜 폐점하려고 해요?

translation.en: We still haven't gotten three Michelin stars yet.
We're not number one yet.
I will translate it into Mandarin for you tomorrow.
Okay, thank you.
All the best.
Why did you give up, Chef?
Thank you, Chef.
Did you know that I would be a chef when I was a kid?
translation.ko: 제가 어렸을 때 셰프를 꿈꾼 걸 아셨어요?

translation.en: No, not at all.
-Not 1.5kg? -Almost 3kg.
Seeing all this seafood makes you want to cook, right?
They're all so fresh.
The prawns look good too.
That one.
-Mother's Day Sale! -Yes.
Mother's Day Mega Sale!
Can I have an autograph?
-A discount for the whitebait in exchange? -Two fish for an autograph!
translation.ko: - 대신 백어 깎아 줘요 - 두 마리 드릴게요

translation.en: -How many do you want? I'll give you two. -Two fish? I can't take them.
translation.ko: - 몇 마리 줄까요? - 두 마리요? 못 받죠

translation.en: One bag for you.
I'm sorry, I didn't recognize you earlier.
You were standing in front of me for so long.
-Thank you. -Thank you. How much for the fish?
-No charge, it's fine. -Really?
You're too generous.
You're so tall.
I haven't seen you in real life, you're so tall.
Seeing that so many people like your son, how do you feel?
translation.ko: 아들이 환대받는 모습을 보니 기분이 어때요?

translation.en: I share his honor.
How do you say that in English?
Even though he's very popular,
all I wish for him is peace and health.
I hope he won't experience hardships.
Don't all mothers wish that for their children?
Am I right?
-Thank you. Happy Mother's Day! -Thank you.
He was in such a faraway place.
As a mother, I didn't know
that being a chef would be so hard.
He went over there
and lost a lot of weight.
He never tells me about the hardships that he had experienced.
translation.ko: 하지만 힘든 내색을 전혀 안 했죠

translation.en: While he's at work,
I would think about
what I should buy and which Taiwanese dishes I should cook for him.
translation.ko: 어떤 타이완 요리를 해 줄지 고민했어요

translation.en: I don't know how to speak French, so when I went to the supermarket,
translation.ko: 프랑스어를 못 해서 슈퍼에 갔을 때

translation.en: I simply thought that bacon would go well with anything.
I bought tomatoes to make his favorite, fried eggs with tomatoes.
translation.ko: 토마토도 샀어요 아들이 좋아하는 달걀토마토 요리를 하려고요

translation.en: Since he was a young boy, I never had to worry about him.
I know that he has his own thoughts
about what he wants to do every step of his way
because I know him very well.
SAUSAGE WITH STICKY RICE
SMOKED BONELESS CHICKEN FEET
translation.ko: 향수를 불러일으키는 맛을 "훈제 뼈 없는 닭발" 찾고 싶었어요

translation.en: I want an assorted one.
-Okay, do you want it spicy? -Yes.
-Okay. -I want it more burnt.
-No problem. -Thank you.
Can I have a photo with you?
translation.ko: 같이 사진 한 장 찍어도 돼요?

translation.en: Yes, of course!
Seeing you in person for the first time makes me so happy!
-One, two, three. One more. Okay. -Thank you.
translation.ko: - 하나, 둘, 셋, 한 장 더요 - 고마워요

translation.en: RAW is so hard to book. We couldn't get a reservation.
Yes, RAW is quite popular, so you have to book it earlier, around two months in advance.
translation.ko: 네, 인기가 많아서 두 달 전에 예약해야 해요

translation.en: -Two months earlier would be best? -Yes.
-I see, thank you! -Thank you, bye!
-Chef, are you doing well these days? -Very well.
You're back in Taiwan now. What a waste!
No, it's not a waste.
I hope to spend more time in Taiwan.
I never had the luxury of time to do so, but now I do.
translation.ko: 그간 그럴 여유가 없었는데 이제 생겼거든요

translation.en: But why do you want to come back to Taiwan?
The market for fine dining in Taiwan is not very good.
I think it's a mission for me.
If everyone believes that the environment won't improve,
translation.ko: 모두 환경이 개선되지 않을 거라고 믿는다면

translation.en: then it will never improve.
Yes, now there's Danny's Steakhouse and other restaurants that are a bit…
Just like how ten years ago, when I went to Singapore,
they didn't have anything
-like Restaurant André. -Yes.
So…
I think…
it's up to us to create that environment
and not expect that the environment would be right for us.
translation.ko: 저절로 조성될 거라고 기대하면 안 돼요

translation.en: -Is that so? -Yes.
-Okay, it's been a pleasure meeting you. -All the best.
We'll let you handle Taiwan's Michelin stars.
-Thank you! -Bye, Chef.
Bye.
Why is that lamp so slanted?
The one at the bottom.
You have to tighten the screw.
Is that okay? It's still slanted.
Okay, stabilize it.
And why is the ceiling making a weird noise?
It's the air conditioner.
Perhaps up there…
Chef said the air conditioner is too noisy.
It wasn't like that before.
It is, but it's quieter in the restaurant now,
so you can hear it clearly.
No.
It didn't.
We'll get someone to check on it.
That morning, I was in a cab on the way to work
and I received a very surprising text that Chef was coming back to Taiwan.
translation.ko: 셰프님이 타이완으로 돌아온다는 놀라운 문자를 받았어요

translation.en: My mind was blank.
When I entered the kitchen,
I saw that everyone was already discussing Chef's reason for coming back.
translation.ko: 셰프님이 돌아오는 이유를 모두 얘기 중이었죠

translation.en: And the next reaction I had was,
"Oh no, I'll be under a lot of stress because he's coming back."
So while everyone is happy that Chef is returning,
there's a part of us that is very worried about the stress.
I don't want anyone to be lazy
and stop improving.
Talk about the wine we have today.
This serves as a review for yourself and as a form of practice for your other colleagues.
Then it becomes something that you've acquired.
It's not only his and also not only hers.
You can ask Antoine or Sherry.
When we were at Restaurant André, would we do that?
We wouldn't.
If the wine we're serving today is the same as yesterday,
we'd still include it in the briefing, right?
From the first bottle to the last, we'd go through them.
During our briefing, I don't wish for us to only talk about the good things.
translation.ko: 브리핑 때 좋은 얘기만 하지 말고

translation.en: Every detail has to be covered.
So I want Antoine and Sherry…
After going through the usual items,
let's talk about what we could have learned from yesterday
translation.ko: 어제 영업을 하며 배운 것을 얘기하고

translation.en: and what we should focus on today.
-Okay. -Okay.
-Bon service. -Bon service!
All ready?
Are you prepared?
-Yes. -Okay, let's open the doors.
Okay.
-Hello, how are you? -How are you?
Hi.
-Yes. -Yes.
-Yes. -Yes.
This one is not dusted?
-Which one? -This one.
It is.
Why can't I see any difference?
Can you see the difference?
It's all here.
-The dusting has to be enough. -Okay.
Remember, the food has to match.
If you have three things,
one is hot, one is cold,
-both must be served at the same time. -Yes, got it.
translation.ko: - 둘 다 동시에 내야 해 - 네

translation.en: Or serve the salamander first before you serve the foie gras.
translation.ko: 아니면 푸아 그라 전에 샐러맨더를 내든지

translation.en: Okay.
-It's all dried up. Hey. -Yes.
-See you next time, bye. -Bye.
Thank you.
Chef, you're so cruel by cooking that at this time.
You're starving, aren't you? It smells really good.
It's the flavor of Taiwan.
You think so?
I feel the same way too.
-You're going to get some… -Yes.
Do you want to go inside?
EE HOE HEAN CLUB
